enWisdom: Silence is a means of deliverance
The intelligent person is one who fetters his tongue
Silence is the garden of contemplation
Silence is the sign of nobility and the fruit of intelligence

Wisdom: أَحْسَنُ الصَّمْتِ مَا كَانَ عَنِ الزَّلَلِ
enWisdom: The best silence is that which prevents [one] from error

Wisdom: أَحْمَدُ مِنَ الْبَلَاغَةِ الصَّمْتُ حِينَ لَا يَنْبَغِي الْكَلَامُ
enWisdom: Remaining silent when speech is inappropriate is more praiseworthy than eloquence

Wisdom: إِنَّمَا يَسْتَحِقُّ اسْمَ الصَّمْتِ الْمُضْطَلِعُ بِالْإِجَابَةِ وَإِلَّا فَالْعِيُّ بِهِ أَوْلَى
enWisdom: Only the one who is capable of giving a reply [but does not do so] can be called ‘silent’; otherwise ‘inarticulate’ is more appropriate a description

Wisdom: إِذَا غُلِبْتَ عَلَى الْكَلَامِ فَإِيَّاكَ أَنْ تُغْلَبَ عَلَى السُّكُوتِ
enWisdom: When you are overcome by speech then be careful not to be overcome by silence

Wisdom: إِذَا تَكَلَّمْتَ بِالْكَلِمَةِ مَلَكَتْكَ وَإِذَا أَمْسَكْتَهَا مَلَكْتَهَا
enWisdom: When you speak a word, it controls you but when you withhold it, you control it
Many a speech is such that the [appropriate] reply for it is silence
Many an utterance is such that silence is better than it
Sometimes silence is more eloquent than speech

Wisdom: صَمْتُكَ حَتَّى تُسْتَنْطَقَ أَجْمَلُ مِنْ نُطْقِكَ حَتَّى تُسْكَتَ
enWisdom: Your remaining silent until you are requested to speak is better than your speaking until you are requested to become silent

Wisdom: صَمْتٌ تُحْمَدُ عَاقِبَتُهُ خَيْرٌ مِنْ كَلَامٍ تُذَمُّ مغتبه [مَغَبَّتُهُ‏]
enWisdom: Silence, the result of which is praised, is better than speech whose consequence is dispraised
Indeed successful is the God-wary person who [always] remains silent

Wisdom: كُنْ صَمُوتاً مِنْ غَيْرِ عِيٍّ فَإِنَّ الصَّمْتَ زِينَةُ الْعَالِمِ وَسِتْرُ [سِرُّ] الْجَاهِلِ
enWisdom: Be a person of much silence without being inarticulate, for indeed silence is the embellishment of the scholar and the cloak [that hides the ignorance] of the ignorant
One who has intelligence remains silent [until there is a need to speak]
There is no worship like silence
Silence is the sign of forbearance [and judiciousness]
Silence is the adornment of knowledge and the symbol of forbearance [and judiciousness]
How good a companion of forbearance silence is!
There is no forbearance like silence
Silence is dignity and idle talk is disgrace
Silence is dignity and safety

Wisdom: الصَّمْتُ يُكْسِيكَ الْوَقَارَ وَيَكْفِيكَ مَئُونَةَ الِاعْتِذَارِ
enWisdom: Silence covers you with dignity and suffices as your provision for seeking pardon
Through silence, reverence increases

Wisdom: صَمْتٌ يَكْسِبُكَ الْوَقَارُ خَيْرٌ مِنْ كَلَامٍ يَكْسُوكَ الْعَارَ
enWisdom: Silence that earns you reverence is better than words that drape you with disgrace
Increased silence earns you reverence
There is no reverence like silence
Espouse silence and your thoughts will remain hidden (or will become illuminated)
Remain silent in your lifetime and your affair will become lofty

Wisdom: الْزَمِ الصَّمْتَ يُلْزِمْكَ النَّجَاةَ وَالسَّلَامَةَ وَالْزَمِ الرِّضَا يُلْزِمْكَ الْغِنَاءَ [الرِّضَا] وَالْكَرَامَةَ
enWisdom: Espouse silence and you will be accompanied by safety and security; espouse contentment and you will be accompanied by prosperity and honour

Wisdom: الْزَمِ السُّكُوتَ وَاصْبِرْ عَلَى الْقَنَاعَةِ بِأَيْسَرِ الْقُوتِ تَعِزَّ فِي دُنْيَاكَ وَتَعِزَّ [تغز] فِي أُخْرَاكَ
enWisdom: Espouse silence and be patient with contentment for the little provision [that you have], [and as a result] you will become great (or your will overcome) in your world and will become great in your Hereafter

Wisdom: إِنْ أَحْبَبْتَ سَلَامَةَ نَفْسِكَ وَسَتْرَ مَعَايِبِكَ فَأَقْلِلْ كَلَامَكَ وَأَكْثِرْ صَمْتَكَ يَتَوَفَّرْ فِكْرُكَ وَيَسْتَنِرْ قَلْبُكَ وَيَسْلَمِ النَّاسُ مِنْ يَدِكَ
enWisdom: If you would like to remain safe and conceal your faults, then reduce your speech and increase your silence, [by this] your thinking will abound, your heart will become illuminated and people will remain safe from you
Remedy your anger with silence and your lust with reason

Wisdom: صَمْتٌ يَكْسُوكَ الْكَرَامَةَ خَيْرٌ مِنْ قَوْلٍ يُكْسِبُكَ النَّدَامَةَ
enWisdom: Silence that covers you with honour is better than speech that earns you regret
The silence of the ignorant person is his covering

Wisdom: عَلَيْكَ بِلُزُومِ الصَّمْتِ فَإِنَّهُ يُلْزِمُكَ السَّلَامَةَ وَيُؤْمِنُكَ النَّدَامَةَ
enWisdom: Cling to silence, for it keeps you safe and saves you from regret
The veil of wrongdoing is silence
One who maintains silence is safe from reproach
One who maintains silence is safe from aversion [and hatred of others]
There is no guardian that is more protective than silence
There is no treasurer [and protector of secrets] better than silence
Espouse silence, for the least of its benefits is safety
Be silent and you will remain safe

Wisdom: إِنْ كَانَ فِي الْكَلَامِ الْبَلَاغَةُ فَفِي الصَّمْتِ‏ السَّلَامَةُ مِنَ الْعِثَارِ
enWisdom: If there is eloquence in speech, then in silence there is safety from blunder
The cause of safety is silence

Wisdom: صَمْتٌ يُعْقِبُكَ السَّلَامَةَ خَيْرٌ مِنْ نُطْقٍ [قَوْلٍ‏] يُعْقِبُكَ الْمَلَامَةَ
enWisdom: Silence that is results in your safety is better than speech that is results in your reproach
One who remains silent is safe

Wisdom: مَنْ سَكَتَ فَسَلِمَ كَمَنْ تَكَلَّمَ فَغَنِمَ
enWisdom: One who remains safe by being silent is like the one who derives benefit by speaking
Silence without contemplation is dumbness
